results.definition: (printing) a block of type without a raised letter; used for spacing between words or sentences
the unlimited expanse in which everything is located
examples: they tested his ability to locate objects in space
it all happened in the space of 10 minutes

results.definition: any location outside the Earth's atmosphere
examples: the astronauts walked in outer space without a tether
the first major milestone in space exploration was in 1957, when the USSR's Sputnik 1 orbited the Earth

results.definition: a blank character used to separate successive words in writing or printing
examples: he said the space is the most important character in the alphabet
write your name in the space provided

results.definition: an area reserved for some particular purpose
an empty area (usually bounded in some way between things)
examples: the architect left space in front of the building
they stopped at an open space in the jungle

results.definition: one of the areas between or below or above the lines of a musical staff
examples: the spaces are the notes F-A-C-E
